channel.title: Windows 11 on Quickly How Tutorials
channel.description: Recent content in Windows 11 on Quickly How Tutorials

item.title: How to Edit the Print Settings in the Microsoft Whiteboard App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Change Printing Orientation: With Print Window With System Dialog With Printing Preferences How to Change Color Settings: With Print Window With System Dialog With Printing Preferences How to Change Paper Size How to Change Printing Scale How to Change Pages per Sheet How to Change Margins How to Add or Remove the Header and Footer How to Add or Remove Background Graphics How to Change Page Order How to Change Paper Source How to Change Media No time to scroll down?

item.title: How to Print in the Microsoft Whiteboard App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Print in Whiteboard: With Print Window With System Dialog How to Close the Print Window: With Click With Keyboard Shortcut With Close How to Specify Pages: With Print Window With System Dialog How to Print on Both Sides: With Print Window With Printing Preferences How to Add a Printer: With Print Window With System Dialog How to Change the Printer: With Print Window With System Dialog How to Let Whiteboard Change Printing Preferences No time to scroll down?

item.title: How to Manage Whiteboards in the Microsoft Whiteboard App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Rename a Whiteboard: With Menu With “More Options” How to Share a Whiteboard How to Export a Whiteboard: As an Image As a PDF As a Zip File How to Navigate the Whiteboard Downloads Window: How to Open the Downloads Window How to Close the Downloads Window How to Search the Downloads Window How to Clear All History in the Downloads Window How to Open the Computer Downloads Folder How to Report a Whiteboard No time to scroll down?

item.title: How to Close the Microsoft Whiteboard App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Delete a Whiteboard How to Close Microsoft Whiteboard: With Click With Right Click With Hover Witih Hover and Right Click With Keyboard Shortcuts No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a tutorial video: How to Delete a Whiteboard Step 1: First open a whiteboard. In the upper left click the “My whiteboards” or house button. Step 2: Hover over a whiteboard and click the “More options” or “…” button.

item.title: How to Open Content in Microsoft Whiteboard (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Open Images How to Open PDFs How to Open the Timer How to Open the Ruler: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut How to Open the Source Code How to Open the “Find” Window No time to scroll down? Click through these tutorial slides: Follow along with a video tutorial: How to Open Images Step 1: First open a whiteboard. On the bottom toolbar click the “More options” or “…” button.

item.title: How to Pin the Microsoft Whiteboard App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Pin Microsoft Whiteboard To the Taskbar: With Search With Right Click From Start How to Pin Microsoft Whiteboard To Start No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a tutorial video: How to Pin Microsoft Whiteboard to the Taskbar With Search Step 1: Go down to the taskbar and click the Start (four blue squares) button. Step 2: In the Start window that opens, click the top search bar and type “whiteboard”.

item.title: How to Open the Microsoft Whiteboard App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: What is Microsoft Whiteboard? How to Open Microsoft Whiteboard With Search How to Open a Blank Whiteboard: With Click With Close By Default How to Open a Whiteboard Template: With the Templates Window With Preview With Menu How to Refresh a Whiteboard No time to scroll down? Click through these tutorial slides: Follow along with a video tutorial: What is Microsoft Whiteboard? As a cloud-based or online app, Microsoft Whiteboard enables multiple users to collaborate on digital whiteboards in real time.

item.title: How to Create a Log in the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Create a Log in Notepad: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcuts With Code No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a tutorial video: How to Create a Log in Notepad With Menu Step 1: First open a Notepad window. In the upper left click the “Edit” button. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Time/Date”. Notepad inserts the current time and date into the document.

item.title: Microsoft Notepad Keyboard Shortcuts (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: 1. Menu Keyboard Shortcuts 2. File Menu Keyboard Shortcuts 3. Edit Menu Keyboard Shortcuts 4. Find and Replace Keyboard Shortcuts 5. View Menu Keyboard Shortcuts No time to scroll down? Click through these tutorials slides: See a video tutorial: Menu Keyboard Shortcuts First open a Notepad window. On the keyboard, hold Alt and press one of the corresponding keys to open that menu. For example, press Alt + F to open the File menu.

item.title: How to Set the Header/Footer in the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: 1. How to Remove the Header/Footer 2. How to Add the Header/Footer 3. What are the Header and Footer Codes? 4. How to Add Custom Words to the Header/Footer No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a tutorial video: How to Remove the Header/Footer Step 1: First open a Notepad window. In the lower left click “More settings”. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Page setup”.

item.title: How to Save in the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Save a File: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut How to Save As: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut How to Save Multiple Files: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a tutorial video: How to Save a File With Menu Step 1: First edit a Notepad file. In the upper left click the “File” button. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Save”.

item.title: How to Edit the Display of the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Change the Font: With Menu With Settings How to Change the Reading Order How to Insert Unicode Control Characters How to Show Unicode Control Characters How to Apply Reconversion No time to scroll down? Click through these tutorial slides: Follow along with a video tutorial: How to Change the Font With Menu Step 1: First edit a Notepad file. In the upper left click the “Edit” button.

item.title: How to Navigate the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Use “Go To”: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut How to Clear the “Go To” Window How to Exit the “Go To” Window: With Click With Keyboard No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a tutorial video: How to Use "Go To" With Menu Step 1: First edit a Notepad file. In the upper left click the “Edit” button. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Go to”.

item.title: How to Search for Text in the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Use Find: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut How to Use Find Next: With Menu With Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Use Find Previous: With Menu With Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Apply Match Case How to Apply Wrap Around How to Clear the Find Bar How to Exit the Find Window: With Click With Keyboard How to Use Find and Replace: With Menu With Click With Keyboard Shortcut No time to scroll down?

item.title: How to Undo and Redo in the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Undo: With Menu With Right Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Redo With Keyboard Shortcut No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Follow along with a tutorial video: How to Undo With Menu Step 1: First edit a Notepad file. In the upper left click the “Edit” button. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Undo”. Notepad reverses the last action. How to Undo With Right Click Step 1: Edit a Notepad file.

item.title: How to Edit Files in the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Edit Text in Notepad How to Select Text in Notepad: With Menu With Right Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Copy Text in Notepad: With Menu With Right Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Cut Text in Notepad: With Menu With Right Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Paste Text in Notepad: With Menu With Right Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Delete Text in Notepad: With Menu With Right Click With Keyboard No time to scroll down?

item.title: How to Edit the Microsoft Notepad App Settings (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Choose How Files Are Opened How to Adjust When Notepad Starts No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a video tutorial: How to Choose How Files Are Opened Step 1: First open Notepad. In the upper right click the “Settings” or gear button. Step 2: In the Settings window that opens, click the “Opening files” drop-down menu and select either “Open in a new tab” or “Open in a new window”.

item.title: How to Edit the Microsoft Notepad App Display (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Add/Remove the Status Bar How to Add/Remove Word Wrap With Menu With Settings How to Change the Notepad App Theme Color No time to scroll down? Click through these presentation slides: Watch a tutorial video: How to Add/Remove the Status Bar Step 1: First open Notepad. In the upper left click the “View” button. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Status bar” to toggle this option on or off.

item.title: How to Use Zoom in the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Zoom In: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut How to Zoom Out: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut How to Restore Default Zoom: With Menu With Keyboard Shortcut No time to scroll down? Click through this tutorial presentation: Follow along with a video tutorial: How to Zoom In With Menu Step 1: First open Notepad. In the upper left click the “View” button. Step 2: In the menu that opens, hover over “Zoom”, and in the second menu that opens click “Zoom in”.

item.title: How to Move the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Move Notepad: With Mouse With Right Click With Menu With a Tab How to Move a Tab: Outside a Window Into a Window No time to scroll down? Click through these presentation slides: Watch a video tutorial: How to Move Notepad With Mouse Step 1: First open Notepad. At the top of the window, click, hold, and drag the mouse to move the window. Release the mouse to stop moving the window.

item.title: How to Restore the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Restore Notepad: With Click With Double Click With Right Click With Menu No time to scroll down? Click through these presentation slides: Watch a video tutorial: How to Restore Notepad With Click Step 1: First maximize Notepad. Go to the upper right and click the “Maximize” button. The Notepad window is restored to its original size. How to Restore Notepad With Double Click Step 1: Maximize Notepad.

item.title: How to Maximize the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Maximize Notepad: With Click With Double Click With Right Click With Menu No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Follow along with a video: How to Maximize Notepad With Click Step 1: First open Notepad. Go to the upper right and click the “Maximize” button. The Notepad window maximizes. How to Maximize Notepad With Double Click Step 1: Open Notepad. Double click the top of the window.

item.title: How to Minimize the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Minimize Notepad: With Click With Right Click With Menu No time to scroll down? Click through these tutorial slides: Watch a video tutorial: How to Minimize Notepad With Click Step 1: First open Notepad. Go to the upper right and click the “Minimize” or “-” button. The Notepad window minimizes. How to Minimize Notepad With Right Click Step 1: Open Notepad. Right click either the top or the upper left corner of the window.

item.title: How to Resize the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Resize Notepad: With Mouse With Right Click With Menu No time to scroll down? Click through this tutorial presentation: Watch a tutorial video: How to Resize Notepad With Mouse Step 1: First open Notepad. Hover the mouse over any edge or corner of the window, until the cursor becomes a double sided arrow. Step 2: Click, hold, and drag the mouse to resize the window. Release the mouse to stop resizing the window.

item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Pin Notepad to the Taskbar: With Search With Right Click From Start How to Pin Notepad to Start No time to scroll down? item.title: How to Open the Microsoft Notepad App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: What is Notepad? How to Open Notepad With Search No time to scroll down? Click through this tutorial presentation: Watch a video tutorial: What is Notepad? Notepad is a basic text editor that comes with Windows 11. This app creates text files for various applications, such as editing code or writing stories. Notepad can save files with UTF-8 encoding, and customize document headers and footers with special codes.

item.title: How to Edit the Microsoft Sticky Notes App Settings (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Enable Insights in a Sticky Note How to Turn “Confirm Before Deleting” Off: With Settings With Click No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: See it in action with this video: How to Enable Insights in a Sticky Note Step 1: First open the Notes List. Go to the upper right and click the “Settings” or gear button. Step 2: In the Settings window that opens, click under the “Enable Insights” section to toggle this option on.

item.title: How to Delete Sticky Notes in the Microsoft Sticky Notes App (Windows 11)

Click through these tutorial slides: Follow along with a video tutorial: How to Delete a Sticky Note With Menu Step 1: First open a sticky note. Go to the upper right and click the “Menu” or “…” button. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Delete note”.

item.title: How to Undo and Redo in the Microsoft Sticky Notes App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Undo: With Right Click With Keyboard Shortcut How to Redo: With Right Click With Keyboard Shortcut No time to scroll down? Click through this presentation tutorial: Watch a tutorial video: How to Undo With Right Click Step 1: First edit a sticky note. Right click anywhere in the note. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Undo”. The previous action is reversed. How to Undo With Keyboard Shortcut Step 1: Edit a sticky note.

Go to the upper left corner and click the “New note” or “+” button. A new sticky note appears. Method 2: Open a sticky note.

item.title: How to Show All Notes in the Microsoft Sticky Notes App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: How to Show All Notes: With Right Click With Start No time to scroll down? Click through this tutorial presentation: Watch a tutorial video: How to Show All Notes With Right Click Step 1: First minimize or hide all notes. Go down to the taskbar and right click the Sticky Notes app icon. Step 2: In the menu that opens, click “Show all notes”. The Notes List and all sticky notes display on the Desktop.

Double click the top of the maximized Notes List. The Notes List is restored to its original size before being maximized.

item.title: How to Open the Microsoft Sticky Notes App (Windows 11)
item.description: This tutorial covers: What is the Microsoft Sticky Notes App? How to Open the Microsoft Sticky Notes App With Search No time to scroll down? Click through this tutorial presentation: Watch a tutorial video here: What is the Microsoft Sticky Notes App? Sticky Notes is a note-taking app that comes with Windows 11. Notes can have formatted text (bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, and bulleted lists), images, and recognized URLs. For further customization, choose from seven different colors of sticky notes and a “Dark” mode for the app.
